items.title: Spyware maker sentenced to prison in Greece for wiretapping politicians and journalists
items.summary: A Greek court on Thursday sentenced the founder of Intellexa, a collective of spyware makers, to eight years in prison for illegal wiretapping and privacy violations, according to several reports.  Tal Dilian and three other Intellexa executives were tried for their role in a scandal dubbed “Greek Watergate,” which dates back to 2022. The Greek […]

items.summary: X has launched an expanded set of aspect ratio support for both image and video ads, so advertisers can now reuse assets they've created for other platforms.

items.title: This compact 3,200mAh portable area light covers up to 6 nights of illumination while doubling as a power bank from $24 (39% off)
items.summary:
BougeRV Portable Camping Area Light

Buy for $24 (Reg. $40)

What we love

As you prep those spring and summer outing plans (once we shake off all this winter snowfall), you might want to consider adding this BougeRV portable area light to your kit – and it’s great for year-round use, too. With four colorway options, this light sports a 3,200mAh battery that can keep spaces illuminated for up to 6 nights on a single charge, complete with five adjustable brightness levels, four lighting modes, and even an S.O.S. signal for emergencies. What’s more, it even doubles as a power bank to keep your phone or other essentials powered up when off-grid or far from any outlet.

items.title: Heads up! Rare deal drops Samsung’s 4TB T5 EVO portable drive to $299 while SSD prices continue to surge ($281 off)
items.summary:
SSD deals have been pretty hard to find lately, with prices continuing to rise in 2026 amid the ongoing global memory shortage. That’s exactly why you might want to jump in and snag this deal that gets you Samsung’s 4TB T5 EVO portable SSD for $299 shipped. For context, Samsung currently lists the 4TB model at a steep $580 on its online store, so you’re saving a massive $281 with this Walmart deal. It’s also the lowest price we’ve tracked for this drive in recent months, making it a standout option when most 4TB SSDs are still hovering north of $400 at Amazon and other retailers. Even SanDisk’s new Extreme Pro is priced significantly higher at around $920 right now, which makes this an absolute steal. This is about as good as it gets right now if you’ve been waiting to grab a high-capacity portable SSD, so grab it after getting more details below.
